intro: Allionia decumbens var. assurgens, commonly known as the creeping allionia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that features small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has slender, prostrate stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread along the ground. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is often found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
